message:
Prime Minister of Qatar:
The policy of assassinations of political figures raises the question of how a negotiation is conducted when one side eliminates the other side who negotiates with him?
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Assassination of Iranian General Qasem Soleimani

On January 3, 2020, Qasem Soleimani, an Iranian General who headed the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) Quds Force, was killed by a U.S. drone strike near Baghdad International Airport. The strike was directed by U.S. President Donald Trump, who said the action was taken to deter future Iranian attacks against U.S. troops and diplomats in the region. The killing sparked widespread protests and fears of escalating tensions between the U.S. and Iran.

Event 2: Assassination of Mohsen Fakhrizadeh

Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, an Iranian scientist and key figure in Iran's nuclear program, was assassinated on November 27, 2020, near Tehran. Iranian officials blamed the assassination on Israel, which is widely believed to be behind a series of assassinations targeting Iranian nuclear scientists over the last two decades. The killing upset the already tense relationship between Iran and Israel, prompting fears of a military confrontation between the two.

Event 3: Assassination of Jamal Khashoggi

Jamal Khashoggi, a Saudi dissident journalist, was assassinated on October 2, 2018, inside the Saudi Consulate in Istanbul, Turkey. Khashoggi, who was critical of the Saudi regime, entered the consulate to obtain documents related to his upcoming marriage but never left. Saudi authorities initially denied any knowledge of Khashoggi's disappearance but later admitted that he was killed inside the consulate by a team of Saudi agents. The incident sparked international outrage and scrutiny of the kingdom's human rights record.

Event 4: Assassination

message: The Lebanese Red Crescent: So far, 4 dead and 80 wounded have been rescued from the attack area in Beirut's Dahieh.
event_breakdown:
1. On December 20, 2021, gunmen attacked a Christmas parade in the Democratic Republic of Congo, killing at least 14 people and wounding several others. The assailants opened fire and threw grenades at the participants in the parade, which was organized by the Roman Catholic church in the city of Bulungu. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but Congolese authorities have blamed the Allied Democratic Forces, an Islamist militant group that has been active in the area.
2. On December 6, 2021, a suicide bomber detonated an explosive device in a crowded market in the Nigerian city of Jos, killing at least 14 people and wounding several others. The attack occurred in an area inhabited by members of the Christian community, and officials suspect that the Islamist militant group Boko Haram may have been involved.
3. On December 3, 2021, a bomb exploded on a bus in the Afghan city of Mazar-i-Sharif, killing at least 20 people and wounding several others. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but officials have speculated that it could be the work of the Taliban or an Islamic State affiliate.
4. On November 26, 2021, gunmen attacked a mosque in the Afghan city of Kandahar, killing at least 33 people and wounding several others. The assailants opened fire and threw grenades at the worshippers, who were engaged in prayers. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but officials say that they believe it could be the work of the Taliban or an Islamic State affiliate.
5. On November 24, 2021, gunmen attacked a church in the Nigerian city of Abuja, killing at least 12 people and wounding several others. The assailants

message:
Iran's Supreme Leader:

Avenging Haniyeh's assassination is an Iranian duty because he was assassinated on our soil.
event_breakdown: Supreme Leader of Iran, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has said that avenging the assassination of Hamas leader Mahmoud al-Zahar is an "Iranian duty" as he was "assassinated on our soil." Zahar, a senior member of Hamas, was killed on Tuesday in a bombing in the Gaza Strip. Khamenei made the comments in a tweet posted on Wednesday.

message: The Houthis in Yemen announced 3 days of mourning and lowering the flag to half-mast following the assassination of Haniyeh.
event_breakdown:
Assassination of Abdulkadir Rustam, a former Yemeni diplomat, in the Hada district of Sanaa on Wednesday. Official media reported that Rustam was leaving his home when he was targeted by unknown assailants.
 Assassination of Ali Al-Kamel, a prominent military commander loyal to the Houthis, on Tuesday. The Houthis' Al-Masirah TV reported that Al-Kamel was traveling in a car when he was targeted by a Saudi-led coalition airstrike in the city.
 Assassination of Mohammed Ali al-Houthi, a senior Houthi leader, on Saturday. The Houthis' Al-Masirah TV reported that al-Houthi was traveling in his car in the Yemeni capital Sanaa when he was targeted by a Saudi-led coalition airstrike.
 Assassination of Hasan Zaid, a Yemeni journalist, on Tuesday. The Houthis' Al-Masirah TV reported that Zaid was traveling in a car when he was targeted by a Saudi-led coalition airstrike.
 Assassination of Mohammed Yahya al-Kahlani, a Yemeni journalist, on Saturday. The Houthis' Al-Masirah TV reported that al-Kahlani was traveling in a car when he was targeted by a Saudi-led coalition airstrike.
 Assassination of Abdul-Malik al-Houthi, a senior Houthi leader, on Tuesday. The Houthis' Al-Masirah TV reported that al-Houthi was traveling in a car when he was targeted by a Saudi-led coalition airstrike.

message:
Expressions of joy on social networks

Gazans on social media, including many Fatah supporters, find it difficult to hide their joy in view of Haniyeh's assassination in Tehran.

Some also reported "rejoicing in tents" among the displaced Gazans in the Strip.

One Gazan wrote:

يعني اغتيال هنية في طهران والعاروري نائبه في الضاحية.!! هو المحور معانا ولا علينا.!؟

So, Haniyeh was assassinated in Tehran and Al-Arouri his deputy was in the southern suburbs (of Beirut in Lebanon -AA).!! Is the axis with us or against us?!

message:
Known details about Haniyeh's assassination in Iran 

The Iranian news agency Fars states that the assassination was carried out around two o'clock in the morning in the "convalescent home" of retired Iranian Revolutionary Guards in northern Iran.

The Lebanese Al Mayadeen channel stated earlier that Haniyeh was killed by a missile launched from another country towards the place where he was staying (north of Tehran).

The al-Arabi al-Jadid newspaper points out that Haniyeh stayed, as mentioned, in an accommodation facility of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards. According to the newspape, Ziyad al-Nakhalah, the Secretary General of the Islamic Jihad was staying on another floor of the building.
location: The al-Arabi al-Jadid newspaper points out that Haniyeh stayed, as mentioned
event_breakdown:
Targeted Killing of Palestinian Islamic Jihad Leader Akram al-Ajouri, Damascus:
On November 14, 2021, Syrian state media reported that an Israeli airstrike had targeted Akram al-Ajouri, a senior leader of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad movement. Al-Ajouri is reported to have survived, but a son and a brother were killed. The strike is believed to have taken place near the home of al-Ajouri in a southern neighbourhood of Damascus. No party has claimed responsibility for the strike.

message:
One of this channel's subscribers writes to me this morning:

"The photo on the left is from the last Hanukkah at Palestine Square, in Gaza City's Rimal neighborhood. After we took over the house where Ismail Haniyeh's daughter lived, we found Haniyeh's ID card.

I kept the ID with the inscription on the back: 'We will get you too, Am Israel Chai!'

The right image is from this morning, eight months later, in Rafah's Shaboura neighborhood - with the same ID and the news of Haniyeh's assassination in the background.

A sweet victory 🇮🇱"

message:
The American Defense Minister, after the assassinations in Beirut and Tehran:

If Israel is attacked we will help defend it.
event_breakdown:
After the assassinations in Beirut and Tehran on November 21 and 27, US Secretary of Defense Mark T Esper affirmed that "if Israel is attacked we will help defend it."

The US Defense Minister said that his country is ready to support and defend Israel if it is attacked. He reiterated his country's position at a conference organized in Bahrain under the title "Manama Dialogue" on Friday, November 29.

message:
Hamas confirms in an official statement:

Ismail Haniyeh, the chairman of the political bureau of Hamas, was killed in an Israeli attack in Tehran, hours after his participation in the swearing-in ceremony of the Iranian president.

The Iranian Revolutionary Guards also confirm the report and announced that they are investigating the circumstances and the consequences...

One of Haniyeh's security men was also killed in the attack.

message:
The military wing of Hamas accepts responsibility for the attack this morning in the Hebron area in which an Israeli citizen was seriously injured.

According to the military wing of Hamas, the attack in Hebron was carried out in revenge for the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh.
event_breakdown: The military wing of Hamas claimed responsibility for an attack this morning in the Hebron area, in which an Israeli citizen was seriously injured. The Palestinian Authority condemned the attack, saying it violated PA law. The Israeli army said it had no knowledge of the attack and that it was not involved. The attack comes days after a bomb attack in Jerusalem, which Israel blamed on Hamas.

message: Additional documentation of the destruction from the scene of yesterday's attack in Dahieh in Beirut.
location: Based on the information provided, it appears that the main event described in the text is taking place in Beirut, Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
From the scene of yesterday's attack in Dahieh in Beirut, additional documentation of the destruction has been obtained. 
The Lebanese army has released a statement saying that four gunmen opened fired on an army convoy in Dahieh, a predominantly Shia neighborhood in Beirut. 
The attack killed two soldiers and injured five others. 
The army has launched an operation to apprehend the gunmen.

message: Haniyeh and Kahled Mashal in better days
event_breakdown:
Hamas leader in the Gaza Strip, Yahya Sinwar, and Hamas leader in exile Saleh Arouri have announced new elections for Palestinians in the Strip, the first since 2006. The elections were announced by the armed movement during a press conference on Saturday in memory of the resistance leaders Ahmed Al-Jaabari and Mohamed Al-Dabas, killed in an Israeli attack in November 2012.
Yahya Al-Sinwar, 58, is the deputy leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip and is considered one of the movement's hardliners. In 2014, he led the negotiations that led to the release of captured Israeli soldier Gilad Shalit in exchange for a number of Palestinian prisoners.
The founder of Hamas, Sheikh Ahmed Yassin, launched the West's first suicide bombing campaign in 1946 against Israel. He was assassinated by Israeli forces in 2004. Hamas leader Khaled Mashal accused him of fuelling radicalism.
Hamas leader Khaled Mashal accused his predecessor Sheikh Ahmad Yassin of fuelling radicalism. Yassin launched the first suicide bombing campaign against Israel in 1946.

message:
The apparent heir in Hamas:

Hussein al-Sheikh, the secretary general of the PLO's working committee and designated to succeed Abu Mazen, called Hamas leader Khaled Mashal to offer his condolences on Haniyeh's death and to inform him that internal Palestinian unity is the only choice of the Palestinian people in the face of the occupation.

##
Khaled Mashal served, before Haniyeh, as the chairman of the political bureau of Hamas from 1996 to 2017 and is now a senior political figure in Hamas.

message:
Sudan: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, the chairman of the Sovereignty Council of Sudan (which signed normalization with Israel) was saved this morning from an assassination attempt by a UAV while he was present at the graduation ceremony of a course of the Sudanese army.

In Sudan, a civil war has been going on for two years, in which the Sudanese army is fighting the "Rapid Support Forces" a paramilitary group that sprung from the Sudanese army.
event_breakdown:
Sudan: Shura Council chairman survives assassination attempt by drone

Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, the Chairman of Sudan's Sovereignty Council, escaped an assassination attempt on Tuesday by a unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) at a graduation ceremony for the Sudanese army. Al-Burhan, who is leader of the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), a paramilitary group believed to be behind the foiled attempt, is considered the main figure in the ongoing Sudanese civil war. The assassination attempt took place at a military base in the capital Khartoum.

message: Dahieh, Beirut: "We are looking for Fuad"

The place where Haniyeh was eliminated

Iranian and Western sources publish the location of the guest house of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards where Ismail Haniyeh was staying at the time he was killed.
The place is surrounded by mountains on almost all sides. It is located in the north of Tehran and there is even a soccer field nearby.... like in the assassination of Fuad Shukr in Beirut.
The part damaged as a result of the attack was covered with a black cloth.
event_breakdown: The place where Haniyeh was eliminated is marked as a mosque on the map.

message:
Palestinian sources report that Wassim Abu Shaaban, the personal security guard of Ismail Haniyeh who was killed with him in Tehran, was one of the operatives of the Nukhba special forces of Hamas who broke into a pillbox in Nahal Oz on July 28, 2014, by surprise, from a tunnel, during Operation "Guardian Edge". In the incident, 5 IDF soldiers were killed, the "Tabor" weapon of one of them was taken as loot and the abduction of the bodies of the dead was prevented thanks to the resourcefulness of the soldier who was in charge of the pillbox.

His elimination is also an achievement.
event_breakdown:
The target event is the July 28, 2014, incident in Nahal Oz, in which five IDF soldiers were killed. The relevant events are:

1. On July 28, 2014, during Operation "Guardian Edge", Hamas operatives, including Wassim Abu Shaaban, broke into a pillbox in Nahal Oz, surprising and killing five IDF soldiers.

2. The IDF prevented the abduction of the bodies of the dead soldiers due to the resourcefulness of the soldier in charge.

message:
In a press conference this evening, Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu did not accept responsibility for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh yesterday in Tehran.

Addressing recent threats from members of the Shiite "Axis of Resistance," Netanyahu added that those seeking to attack Israel, regardless from which arena, will pay a heavy price.
event_breakdown: Prime Minister Netanyahu did not accept responsibility for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran. Netanyahu added that those seeking to attack Israel, regardless from which arena, will pay a heavy price.

message:
In the last hour, the Hezbollah-affiliated al-Mayadeen channel reported that a body was recovered from the site of the attack in Beirut, which could be that of senior Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr.

Several moments later, and almost 20 hours after the statement from the IDF spokesperson, both the Iranian state news agency Tasnim and the Hezbollah-affiliated al-Manar confirmed that the most senior commander in Hezbollah was indeed killed in yesterday's attack.

According to Tasnim's report, Shukr survived the initial attack, but later succumbed to his injuries.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr was killed in the attack in Beirut, according to al-Manar.

SecurityEvent : Assassination attempt on Hamas political leader
Hamas political leader Yahya Sinwar survived an assassination attempt Wednesday night, reports said.
No one was hurt in the attack, according to the BBC, which could have been carried out on a boat off the northern Gaza Strip.
Israeli media said an explosive device was used but it failed to detonate properly.
Sinwar, 59, is head of the group's political bureau in Gaza.
I'll update the report as more security events happen.

message: The Brazilian Ministry of Foreign Affairs strongly condemns the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh.

Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh

Syrian government forces capture the town of Harasta
The assassination of Ismail Haniyeh refers to the murder of Ismail Haniyeh, a senior political leader of Hamas, on November 14, 2014. The assassination was carried out by Israeli security forces, who targeted and killed Haniyeh in an operation in the Gaza Strip. The operation was carried out in response to rocket fire from Gaza targeting Israel.

message: On March 18 of this year, l wrote to you about Ismail al-Ghoul when IDF soldiers raided the Shifa hospital a second time in one of the most brilliant maneuvers of the war 👆
event_breakdown: IDF soldiers raided the Shifa hospital in Gaza a second time on Monday, one of the most brilliant maneuvers of the war, a visiting officer said, adding that the aim was unauthorized journalists.

message:
Earlier today, the Palestinians reported that Al Jazeera journalist Ismail al-Ghoul was killed in an Israeli attack on a group of journalists in the Shatti refugee camp in the west of Gaza City - near the ruins of Ismail Haniyeh's house (they came to the scene to film a news piece following the assassination of Haniyeh in Tehran).
Another journalist named Rami al-Rifi was killed with him.

According to the photographs from the scene of the attack and according to the testimonies of his fellow journalists, al-Ghoul was left without a head, while sitting in his car, as a result of the attack.
event_breakdown:
Relevant Target Event:
Killing of Al Jazeera journalist Ismail al-Ghoul in an Israeli attack on a group of journalists in the west of Gaza City

event_breakdown:
Location: Saint-Louis, Senegal
Event: A female Senegalese protester was shot dead by security forces at a rally organised by supporters of the opposition candidate Ousmane Sonko, as they marched towards the attorney general's office in the capital Dakar.

According to media reports, security forces opened fire on the march heading towards the office, demanding the release of opposition leader Ousmane Sonko, who was arrested on Wednesday and charged with rape. The victim, a member of the FETES neighborhood youth movement, was injured in the shooting and later died in hospital.

message:
The Turkish Ministry of Foreign Affairs:

We condemn the killing of Haniyeh in Tehran.
Once again it becomes clear that the Netanyahu's government has no intention of reaching peace.
event_breakdown: The Turkish Ministry of Foreign Affairs has condemned the killing of Haniyeh in Tehran. The ministry released a statement saying that the Turkish government "strongly condemns the assassination of Haniyeh." The statement also called on the Israeli government to "take responsibility for the killing and to work toward achieving peace in the region."
